mods.abstract: (Left) Moving day on the bayou as a trapper and his family load a boat to move to the kind of a trapper's settlement shown in the lower left hand picture."(Center) Emanuel Von Lubbe, of the Fur and Refuge division of the Department of Wildlife and Fisheries, checking the pelts of a trapper on one of the state's fur refuges."(Right Below) A typical marshland trapper with a load of trpas as he sets out for the season's work. No the poles are not to fish with. They're to propel him through the marsh."(Below) Below is a typical bayou scene during the Louisiana trapping season.

titleInfo.title: Louisiana Sea Grant Digital Images Collection
